semantic_title: Multiple Sites Coding Guidelines for Musculoskeletal Conditions
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 13. Chapter 13: Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System and Connective Tissue > a. Site and laterality > 2. Multiple sites

content.full_text: Codes describing specified sites are assigned individually by site when documented. When the specified site(s) are not documented, assign the appropriate code for 'multiple sites.' (Evidence: pg no: 61, L33-L34)
content.summary: Assign individual site codes when specific sites are documented; use multiple sites codes when specific sites are not documented (Evidence: pg no: 61, L33-L34)
key_concepts: Individual site assignment (Evidence: pg no: 61, L33)
Multiple sites codes (Evidence: pg no: 61, L34)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Codes describing specified sites are assigned individually by site when documented (Evidence: pg no: 61, L33)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation specifies individual anatomical sites, assign separate codes for each documented site (Evidence: pg no: 61, L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: When the specified site(s) are not documented, assign the appropriate code for 'multiple sites' (Evidence: pg no: 61, L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: Use multiple sites codes when documentation does not specify individual anatomical sites (Evidence: pg no: 61, L34)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review documentation for specific anatomical sites
Step 2: If specific sites documented, assign individual codes for each site
Step 3: If specific sites not documented but multiple sites indicated, assign multiple sites code
Step 4: Ensure all documented sites are coded appropriately

code_ranges.description: Musculoskeletal system codes (Evidence: pg no: 61, L23)
usage_rules: Assign individual codes when sites specified (Evidence: pg no: 61, L33)
Use multiple sites codes when sites not specified (Evidence: pg no: 61, L34)

code_patterns.description: Codes designated for multiple anatomical sites (Evidence: pg no: 61, L34)
code_patterns.explanation: Used when specific sites are not documented

incorrect_coding.rationale: When specific sites are documented, individual codes should be used
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using multiple sites code when specific sites are documented

correct_coding.rationale: Specific sites not documented, so multiple sites code is appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 61, L34)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot assign specific site codes without documentation
